Description: Antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) have established themselves as important options for cancer treatment, and several transformative ADC therapeutics were recently approved for such purposes.  This session seeks to educate attendees regarding recent progress in the development of ADCs for oncology applications including the use of both novel cytotoxics, biologically targeted agents, and immuostimulatory agents as payloads.  Challenges associated with these new research directions will be discussed along with potential solutions (e.g., novel conjugation approaches and/or higher drug-to-antibody loading relative to legacy ADCs).  The application of ADCs to non-oncology indications will also be presented with a focus on utilizing immunosuppressive molecules as payloads.
SearchResultBody: ED001. Chemistry to the Clinic: Part 1 of 3: The Next Generation of Antibody Drug Conjugates
Title: Chemistry to the Clinic: Part 1 of 3: The Next Generation of Antibody Drug Conjugates
